title: President Truman in Backyard of Truman Home
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at right) with an unidentified man in the backyard of 219 N. Delaware. The rose arbor is visible in the background. The President is entertaining members of the Independence Chamber of Commerce, newsmen, and others. Donor: Carol Shipp, slides taken by her father, Orland Murphy. Original slides are SL2465 to SL2481. Credit photo to Orland Murphy.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Congressman John W. McCormack
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) confers with Congressman John W. McCormack (right) during a session of the Democratic National Convention. From: Houston Post.

title: Lauren Bacall on Piano, Truman Playing
Scopenote: Vice-President Harry S. Truman accompanies actress Lauren Bacall on the piano at the National Press Club canteen.  From:  Houston Post

title: President Harry S. Truman and Margaret Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with his daughter Margaret (left) seated on garden furniture in the backyard of their home at 219 North Delaware Street, Independence, Missouri. This photo was taken during Truman's first trip home since being sworn in as President.  From: Carol Shipp.

title: Truman with daughter in backyard
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with his daughter Margaret (left) seated on garden furniture in the backyard of their home at 219 N. Delaware Street. This photo was taken during Truman's first trip home since being sworn in as President.  From: Carol Shipp.

title: Bess Truman and her Independence (MO) bridge club at Shangri-La
Scopenote: First Lady Bess Wallace Truman seated on a patio with three of her friends at Shangri-La, in Maryland.  L to R:  Mrs. William (Louise) Duke, Mrs. Tom (Adelaide) Twyman, Mrs. Kenneth (Mary) Bostian.  Shangri-La later became Camp David.

title: Portrait of T. Willard Hunter
Scopenote: Portrait of T. Willard Hunter used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Hunter.

title: Portrait of John K. Hulston
Scopenote: Portrait of John K. Hulston used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Hulston.

title: Portrait of Merrill C. Gay
Scopenote: Portrait of Merrill C. Gay used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Gay.

title: Portrait of Philip Kaiser
Scopenote: Portrait of Philip Kaiser, which was used with his oral history interview.

title: John Melby
Scopenote: Portrait of John Melby, State Department official, used in his oral history interview at the Truman Library.

title: Portrait of Floyd Boring
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Secret Service agent Floyd Boring, which was used in his oral history interview.
